text: Yaw Kiti Glymin (born 22 July 1993) is an Australian professional rugby league footballer. His position is on the . He previously played for the St. George Illawarra Dragons in the National Rugby League. ==Background== Glymin was born in Arncliffe, New South Wales and is of Ghanaian descent. His name Yaw means Thursday in Ghanaian. He played his junior rugby league for the Arncliffe Scots, before being signed by the St. George Illawarra Dragons. ==Playing career== ===Early career=== Progressing through the St. George Illawarra Dragons Harold Matthews Cup and S. G. Ball Cup squads, Glymin played for the Dragons' NYC team in 2012 and 2013, before moving on to the Dragons' New South Wales Cup team, Illawarra Cutters in 2014. On 27 October 2014, he re-signed with St. George Illawarra on a one-year contract. ===2015=== In round 17 of the 2015 NRL season, Glymin made his NRL debut for St. George Illawarra against the North Queensland Cowboys. On 12 August 2015, Glymin re-signed with St. George on a two-year contract. ===2017=== Glymin was released by St. George at the end of 2017 after only managing to make 1 appearance for the club due to injuries. ==References== ==External links== *St. George Illawarra Dragons profile Category:1993 births Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Australian people of Ghanaian descent Category:St. George Illawarra Dragons players Category:Illawarra Cutters players Category:Rugby league wingers Category:Living people Category:Rugby league players from Sydney
title: Yaw Kiti Glymin
